sub_title: Content & Social Media Specialist at Settly
summary:
Hi there, I'm Joann! 

I'm a Digital Marketer with a global perspective and with over seven years of Marketing experience in Sri Lanka and The Netherlands (combined).  My passions, experiences, and personal growth drive me to deliver impactful strategies that elevate brands and connect with audiences worldwide. 

Originally from Sri Lanka, I've been fortunate to call Dubai, Bahrain, and Sri Lanka my homes before embarking on my current adventure to The Netherlands. As a Third Culture Kid, I embrace the richness of different cultures, making every journey a colourful exploration.

In Sri Lanka, I've successfully managed diverse clients in Finance, Retail, FMCG, Education and Hospitality industries. As a team leader, I've nurtured a people-first approach, leading to award-winning projects that showcased our creativity and strategic thinking. 

In The Netherlands, my specialisation in social media led to exceptional growth, expanding the company's online community by an impressive 233% in just two years. My passion for social media strategy has driven me to deliver results and foster brand growth in diverse markets.

An avid learner, I've honed my skills through programs like the Spikes Digital Academy in Singapore and completing Digital Garage by Google. Spearheading the digital execution of a global campaign - Women of the World Festival in Sri Lanka and the What Now Project remains two of my proudest accomplishments, championing women's empowerment and gender equality.

Beyond my professional experience, I have a deep fondness for travelling and cooking. It ignites my sense of creativity, bringing joy and inspiration. Moreover, I'm a passionate advocate for animal welfare and nature conservation, finding solace in the company of animals and immersing myself in nature's beauty. 

Rooted in an empowered family of women, their support uplifts and inspires me, shaping both my personality and leadership approach.

Life's journey is a tapestry of strength and growth, where challenges become opportunities to rise. Overcoming PTSD taught me the art of healing and the power of my own will. This chapter in my life sparked a passion for uplifting others, embracing empathy and hope for those facing their own battles. It fills me with unwavering courage and a deep love for the beauty of constant growth, inspiring me to embrace each adventure with an open heart.

I'm excited to connect, collaborate, and make a positive impact in the digital landscape and beyond. 

Let's create something extraordinary together!

treasury_media.title: Olly & His Tale for MAS Holdings
treasury_media.description:
In a bid to raise awareness on Sri Lanka’s ocean plastic pollution problem, we created Olly, a sea turtle that spoke to the audience and addressed the fact that, even though none of us are individually to blame for the crisis, collectively we are responsible and we can all act as individuals to create a collective positive change. 

This campaign was awarded 'WINNER- Best Digital Integrated Campaign' in the category of Manufacturing, Transportation, Storage and Logistics at SLT Zero1 Awards 2019

treasury_media.title: #WhatNow Campaign for Women In Need
treasury_media.description:
Our objective was to create a campaign that would raise awareness on why women don't report when they've been victimized to the horrors of Sexual Gender Based Violence . 

Therefore, we decided to rally the influential troops and begin the #WhatNow movement. Once the campaign concluded, it was proven that victims were now given the courage to speak up and ask for help. This resulted in significant mileage for Women in Need as the response for it translated in to a spike in calls for help.

awards.title: YEP 2.0 Youth Empowerment Project
awards.description: A Certification for actively participating and completing all sessions of 'YEP 2.0 Youth Empowerment Project' that was held at the National Youth Center in Maharagama, and organised by AISEC in Sri Lanka in collaboration with National Youth Services Council.

awards.title: Basic Rescue Course
awards.description: Certificate awarded after a Training Program in Basic Rescue Course awarded while being a Rotaractor for the Rotaract Club of ANC.
awards.issuer: Life Saving Association of Sri Lanka

awards.title: Certificate of Appreciation
awards.description: Certification for demonstrating tremendous dedication and commitment to the 6th Edition of the Dubai International Film Festival 2009.

awards.title: GEMS Girls Award 2007-2008
awards.description: The GEMS Award is given each year to an individual student who excels in Academics, Sports and Extra-Curricular Activities.

awards.title: Developing Leadership
awards.description: A certification for completing the 'Developing Leadership - Through the Discovery of Multiple Intelligences'.

awards.title: Global Scholar
awards.description: Nominated by Cambridge International School to be a Global Scholar representing the United Arab Emirates at the Global Young Leaders Conference in Washington D.C.

awards.title: Clean Up The World
awards.description: A certification of gratitude by Dubai Municipality in recognition of sincere efforts and outstanding contribution that had a great impact on making the 'Clean Up The World 2007' a grand success.

awards.title: Youth Leadership Program
awards.description: A Certification awarded in Bahrain for completing the requirements of the Toastmasters Youth Leadership Program.

awards.title: Best News Reader
awards.description: This award was given after a Voice Hunt Competition to find the Best News Reader in all of ANC.

awards.title: Best Presenter
awards.description: This award was given after a Voice Hunt Competition to find the Best Presenter in all of ANC.

projects.title: #WhatNow
projects.description:
Stories of abuse; as courageous as they are; are of the many today. However, due to misinformation and speculation about the nation's judicial system, these acts of bravery remain as they are- stories.

With the ‘WhatNow’ concept, our objective was to create a campaign that would bring about sufficient and qualitative awareness for the dissemination of Women In Need’s research findings on justice sector violations, using influential people in SriLanka to begin a movement to support victims of violence.

contributors.headline: Content & Social Media Specialist at Settly

profile_positions.description: With a team of young digital marketers under my wing, my role is to hire, train and lead them into ensuring that our portfolio of brands have their strategies and campaigns curated and implemented effectively. Being part of the Management, I was also involved with organizational changes within the workspace that needed to be implemented accordingly. Additionally, by working closely with the sales team, my role enabled me to pitch strategic recommendations to potential clients outside of my current scope, both in Sri Lanka and overseas, thereby, broadening my horizons on the various sectors that digital can offer solutions for.
profile_positions.title: Senior Manager- Digital Marketing

profile_positions.description: Social Media was evolving in the Sri Lanka digital space. Growth was inevitable and strategic approaches to digital marketing was a mandatory ingredient with the brands I was directly responsible for. I was able to hone my client relationship skills  and build up my confidence in pitching ideas and other recommendations to existing clients, both in Sri Lanka and overseas.
profile_positions.title: Manager- Digital Marketing

profile_positions.description: During my starter years, I learnt the fundamentals of social media marketing. My client relationship skills set base and I also learnt the ABCs of setting up and managing the social presence for the set of clients I was responsible for. It was during these foundation years, where I was able to gain experience with clients/brands from different sectors whilst on the job, especially when it came to my first online crisis management.
profile_positions.title: Social Media Manager

company.name: Al Noor Center for Special Needs
